intro: Schradera vahlii var. acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved schradera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
